intro: Plectranthastrum rosmarinifolium, commonly known as rosemary bush or rosemary plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as mint and basil. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, needle-like leaves and small, pale blue or purple flowers. It is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and ornamental value. Plectranthastrum rosmarinifolium is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
